description: Network domain allows tracking network activities of the page. It exposes information about HTTP and WebSocket requests and responses, their headers, bodies, timing, etc. It also allows getting the tree of the Frames on the page along with information about their resources.

requestTime.description: Timing's requestTime is a baseline in seconds, while the other numbers are ticks in milliseconds relatively to this requestTime.

connectStart.description: Started connecting to the remote host.

mimeType.description: Resource mimeType as determined by the browser.

requestHeaders.description: Refined HTTP request headers that were actually transmitted over the network.

connectionReused.description: Specifies whether physical connection was actually reused for this request.

connectionID.description: Physical connection id that was actually used for this request.

fromDiskCache.description: Specifies that the resource was loaded from the disk cache.

timing.description: Timing information for the given request.

types.description: Information about the Frame on the page.

loaderId.description: Identifier of the loader associated with this frame.

name.description: Frame's name as specified in the tag.

types.description: Information about the Frame hierarchy along with their cached resources.

frame.description: Frame information for this tree item.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables network tracking, network events will now be delivered to the client.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables network tracking, prevents network events from being sent to the client.

commands.name: getCachedResources
commands.description: Returns present frame / resource tree structure.

commands.name: getResourceContent
commands.description: Returns content of the given resource.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame id to get resource for.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resource to get content for.

parameters.name: base64Encode
parameters.description: Requests that resource content is served as base64.

commands.name: setExtraHeaders
commands.description: Allows sending extra HTTP headers with the requests from this page.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: Map with extra HTTP headers.

events.name: frameDetached
events.description: Fired when frame has been detached from its parent.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: If of the frame that has been detached.

events.name: requestWillBeSent
events.description: Fired when page is about to send HTTP request.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame identifier.

parameters.name: loaderId
parameters.description: Loader identifier.

parameters.name: documentURL
parameters.description: URL of the document this resource is loaded for.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Request data.

parameters.name: redirectResponse
parameters.description: Redirect response data.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: callStack
parameters.description: JavaScript stack trace upon issuing this request.

events.name: resourceMarkedAsCached
events.description: Fired when request is known to be served from memory cache.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

events.name: responseReceived
events.description: Fired when HTTP response is available.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Resource type. // FIXME

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: Response data.

events.name: dataReceived
events.description: Fired when data chunk was received over the network.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: dataLength
parameters.description: Data chunk length.

parameters.name: lengthReceived
parameters.description: Actual bytes received (might be less than dataLength for compressed encodings).

events.name: loadingFinished
events.description: Fired when HTTP request has finished loading.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: finishTime
parameters.description: Timestamp.

events.name: loadingFailed
events.description: Fired when HTTP request has failed to load.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: errorText
parameters.description: User friendly error message.

events.name: resourceLoadedFromMemoryCache
events.description: Fired when HTTP request has been served from memory cache.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame identifier.

parameters.name: loaderId
parameters.description: Loader identifier.

parameters.name: documentURL
parameters.description: URL of the document this resource is loaded for.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Cached resource data.

events.name: initialContentSet
events.description: Fired for XMLHttpRequests when their content becomes available.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Resource content.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Resource type. // FIXME

events.name: frameNavigated
events.description: Fired once navigation of the frame has completed. Frame is now associated with the new loader.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: Frame identifier.

parameters.name: loaderId
parameters.description: Loader identifier.

events.name: webSocketWillSendHandshakeRequest
events.description: Fired when WebSocket is about to initiate handshake.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: WebSocket request data.

events.name: webSocketHandshakeResponseReceived
events.description: Fired when WebSocket handshake response becomes available.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: WebSocket response data.

events.name: webSocketCreated
events.description: Fired upon WebSocket creation.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: WebSocket request URL.

events.name: webSocketClosed
events.description: Fired when WebSocket is closed.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Request identifier.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp.

description: This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an id. This id can be used to get additional information on the Node, convert it into the JavaScript object, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

id.description: Node identifier that is passed into the rest of the DOM messages as the nodeId. Backend will only push node with given id once. It is aware of all requested nodes and will only fire DOM events for nodes known to the client.

children.description: Child nodes of this node when requested with children.

attributes.description: Attributes of the Element node in the form of flat array [name1, value1, name2, value2].

documentURL.description: Document URL that Document or FrameOwner node points to.

types.description: DOM interaction is implemented in terms of mirror objects that represent the actual DOM nodes. DOMNode is a base node mirror type.
DOM interaction is implemented in terms of mirror objects that represent the actual DOM nodes. DOMNode is a base node mirror type.

commands.name: getDocument
commands.description: Returns the root DOM node to the caller.

commands.name: getChildNodes

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to get children for.

commands.description: Requests that children of the node with given id are returned to the caller in form of setChildNodes events.

commands.name: querySelector

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to query upon.

parameters.name: selectors
parameters.description: Selector string.

parameters.name: documentWide
parameters.description: Set to true to start querying from the node's document.

commands.description: Executes querySelector on a given node. Setting documentWide to true starts selecting from the document node.

commands.name: querySelectorAll

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to query upon.

parameters.name: selectors
parameters.description: Selector string.

parameters.name: documentWide
parameters.description: Set to true to start querying from the node's document.

commands.description: Executes querySelectorAll on a given node. Setting documentWide to true starts selecting from the document node.

commands.name: setNodeName

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to set name for.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: New node's name.

commands.description: Sets node name for a node with given id.

commands.name: setNodeValue

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to set value for.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: New node's value.

commands.description: Sets node value for a node with given id.

commands.name: removeNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to remove.

commands.description: Removes node with given id.

commands.name: setAttribute

parameters.name: elementId
parameters.description: Id of the element to set attribute for.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Attribute name.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Attribute value.

commands.description: Sets attribute for an element with given id.

commands.name: removeAttribute

parameters.name: elementId
parameters.description: Id of the element to remove attribute from.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the attribute to remove.

commands.description: Removes attribute with given name from an element with given id.

commands.name: getEventListenersForNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to get listeners for.

commands.description: Returns event listeners relevant to the node.

commands.name: copyNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to copy.

commands.description: Copies node's HTML markup into the clipboard.

commands.name: getOuterHTML

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to get markup for.

commands.description: Returns node's HTML markup.

commands.name: setOuterHTML

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to set markup for.

parameters.name: outerHTML
parameters.description: Outer HTML markup to set.

returns.name: outNodeId
returns.description: Setting outer HTML can change node's id.

commands.description: Sets node HTML markup, returns new node id.

commands.name: performSearch

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Plain text or query selector or XPath search query.

parameters.name: runSynchronously
parameters.description: When set to true, performing search synchronously (can block user interaction).

commands.description: Starts asynchronous search for a given string in the DOM tree. Use cancelSearch to stop given asynchronous search task.

commands.name: cancelSearch
commands.description: Cancels asynchronous search started with performSearch.

commands.name: pushNodeToFrontend

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: JavaScript object id to convert into node.

commands.description: Requests that the node is sent to the caller given the JavaScript node object reference.

commands.name: pushNodeByPathToFrontend

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to node in the proprietary format.

returns.name: nodeId
returns.description: Id of the node for given path.

commands.description: Requests that the node is sent to the caller given its path. // FIXME, use XPath

commands.name: resolveNode

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to resolve.

returns.name: object
returns.description: JavaScript object wrapper for given node.

commands.description: Resolves JavaScript node object for given node id.

events.name: documentUpdated
events.description: Fired when Document has been totally updated. Node ids are no longer valid.

events.name: setChildNodes

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: Parent node id to populate with children.

parameters.name: nodes
parameters.description: Child nodes array.

events.description: Fired when backend wants to provide client with the missing DOM structure. This happens upon most of the calls requesting node ids.

events.name: attributesUpdated

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: New attributes value.

events.description: Fired when Element's attributes are updated.

events.name: characterDataModified

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: New text value.

events.description: Mirrors DOMCharacterDataModified event.

events.name: childNodeCountUpdated

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: New node count.

events.description: Fired when Container's child node count has changed.

events.name: childNodeInserted

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: prevId
parameters.description: If of the previous siblint.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: Inserted node data.

events.description: Mirrors DOMNodeInserted event.

events.name: childNodeRemoved

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: Parent id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the node that has been removed.

events.description: Mirrors DOMNodeRemoved event.

events.name: searchResults

parameters.name: nodeIds
parameters.description: Ids of the search result nodes.

events.description: Pushes search results initiated using performSearch to the client.

description: Timeline provides its clients with instrumentation records that are generated during the page runtime. Timeline instrumentation can be started and stopped using corresponding commands. While timeline is started, it is generating timeline event records.

types.description: Timeline record contains information about the recorded activity.

commands.name: start
commands.description: Starts capturing instrumentation events.

commands.name: stop
commands.description: Stops capturing instrumentation events.

events.name: started
events.description: Fired when timeline has been started.

events.name: stopped
events.description: Fired when timeline has been stopped.

events.name: eventRecorded

parameters.name: record
parameters.description: Timeline record data.

events.description: Fired for every instrumentation event while timeline is started.

description: Debugger domain exposes JavaScript debugging functions. It allows setting and removing breakpoints, stepping through execution, exploring stack traces, etc.

sourceID.description: Script identifier as reported by the scriptParsed

functionName.description: Name of the function called on this frame.

scopeChain.description: Scope chain for given call frame. // FIXME

types.description: Debugger call frame. Array of call frames form call stack.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables debugger for given page.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables debugger for given page.

commands.name: setBreakpointsActive

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: New value for breakpoints active state.

commands.description: Activates / deactivates all breakpoints on the page.

commands.name: setBreakpointByUrl

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resource to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Line number to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Offset in the line to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Expression to use as a breakpoint condition. When specified, debugger will only stop on the breakpoint if this expression evaluates to true.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Determines initial state for the breakpoint.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further manipulations.

returns.name: locations
returns.description: List of the locations this breakpoint resolved into.

commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at a given location specified by URL. This breakpoint will survive page reload.

commands.name: setBreakpoint

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: Source ID of the resource to set breakpoint on (as reported by scriptParsed).

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Line number to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Offset in the line to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Expression to use as a breakpoint condition. When specified, debugger will only stop on the breakpoint if this expression evaluates to true.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Determines initial state for the breakpoint.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further manipulations.

commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at a given location.

commands.name: removeBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes JavaScript breakpoint.

commands.name: continueToLocation

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: Source ID of the resource to continue to (as reported by scriptParsed).

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Line number to stop at.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Column number to stop at.

commands.description: Continues execution until specific location is reached.

commands.name: stepOver
commands.description: Steps over the statement.

commands.name: stepInto
commands.description: Steps into the statement.

commands.name: stepOut
commands.description: Steps out of the function.

commands.name: pause
commands.description: Stops on the next JavaScript statement.

commands.name: resume
commands.description: Resumes JavaScript execution.

commands.name: editScriptSource

parameters.name: sourceID
parameters.description: Id of the script to edit.

parameters.name: newContent
parameters.description: New content of the script.

returns.name: stackFrames
returns.description: New stack trace in case editing has happened while VM was stopped.

commands.description: Edits JavaScript script live.

commands.name: getScriptSource

parameters.name: sourceID
parameters.description: Id of the script to get source for.

commands.description: Returns source for the script with given ID.

commands.name: setPauseOnExceptionsState

parameters.name: pauseOnExceptionsState
parameters.description: Pause on exceptions mode. // FIXME, make enumerable.

commands.description: Defines pause on exceptions state. Can be set to stop on all exceptions, uncaught exceptions or no exceptions.

commands.name: evaluateOnCallFrame

parameters.name: callFrameId
parameters.description: Call frame identifier to evaluate on. This identifier is a part of backtrace reported by the pausedScript.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: Expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: String object group name to put result into (allows rapid releasing resulting object handles using releaseObjectGroup).

parameters.name: includeCommandLineAPI
parameters.description: Specifies whether command line API should be available to the evaluated expression, defaults to false.

returns.name: result
returns.description: Object wrapper for the evaluation result.

commands.description: Evaluates expression on a given call frame.

events.name: debuggerWasEnabled
events.description: Fired when debugger gets enabled.

events.name: debuggerWasDisabled
events.description: Fired when debugger gets disabled.

events.name: scriptParsed

parameters.name: sourceID
parameters.description: Identifier of the script parsed.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the script parsed (if any).

parameters.name: lineOffset
parameters.description: Line offset of the script within the resource with given URL (for script tags).

parameters.name: columnOffset
parameters.description: Column offset of the script within the resource with given URL.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Length of the script

parameters.name: scriptWorldType
parameters.description: Script type. // FIXME.

events.description: Fired when virtual machine parses script. This even is also fired for all known scripts upon enabling debugger.

events.name: scriptFailedToParse

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the script that failed to parse.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Source text of the script that failed to parse.

parameters.name: firstLine
parameters.description: Line offset of the script within the resource.

parameters.name: errorLine
parameters.description: Line with error.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.description: Parse error message.

events.description: Fired when virtual machine fails to parse the script.

events.name: breakpointResolved

parameters.name: breakpointId
parameters.description: Breakpoint unique identifier.

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: Identifier of the script breakpoint is set in.

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Line number of the statement breakpoint is set on.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Column offset of the statement breakpoint is set on.

events.description: Fired when breakpoint is resolved to an actual script and location.

events.name: paused

parameters.name: details

callFrames.description: Call stack the virtual machine stopped on.

parameters.description: Call stack information.

events.description: Fired when the virtual machine stopped on breakpoint or exception or any other stop criteria.

events.name: resumed
events.description: Fired when the virtual machine resumed execution.

description: Browser debugging allows setting breakpoints on particular DOM operations and events. JavaScript execution will stop on these operations as if there was a regular breakpoint set.

commands.name: setDOMBreakpoint

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the operation to stop upon.

commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular operation with DOM.

commands.name: removeDOMBreakpoint

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to remove breakpoint from.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the breakpoint to remove.

commands.description: Removes DOM breakpoint that was set using setDOMBreakpoint.

commands.name: setEventListenerBreakpoint

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Event name to stop on (any DOM event will do).

commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular DOM event.

commands.name: removeEventListenerBreakpoint

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Event name.

commands.description: Removes breakpoint on particular DOM event.

commands.name: setXHRBreakpoint

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Resource URL substring. All XHRs having this substring in the URL will get stopped upon.

commands.description: Sets breakpoint on XMLHttpRequest.

commands.name: removeXHRBreakpoint

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Resource URL substring.

commands.description: Removes breakpoint from XMLHttpRequest.
